Inventory Managment System documentation¶

Add your content using reStructuredText syntax. See the reStructuredText documentation for details.

API Documentation¶

The following modules are available:

Flask Inventory Management Application

The application is a web base business inventory management system built with Flask

Features include:

User authentication with hashed passwords Inventory management with use of database queries (insert, delete, update) Exporting of user items via XML and/or XLSX files Low/No stock tracking Image uploading

class inventory.app.User(user_id, username, user_password, store_name)[source]¶

Bases: UserMixin

User class for Flask-Login

Retrieve user from the database using ID

Parameters:

user_id (int) – ID of user

Returns:

An instance of User class if it exists in the database, otherwise None

inventory.app.add()[source]¶

Add an item to the inventory of the current user

GET:

Render the add item form

POST:

Insert item into inventory table

Returns:

Render template or redict to inventory page

Return type:

str | Response

inventory.app.convert_to_binary(filename)[source]¶

Converts a file via it’s name to binary

Parameters:

filename (str) – Name of the file path to be converted to binary

Returns:

Binary of the file

Return type:

bytes

inventory.app.delete()[source]¶

Delete an inventory item

GET:

Render the delete form

POST:

Delete the specified item

Returns:

Rendered template or redirect to inventory page

Return type:

str | Response

inventory.app.edit_quantity(name)[source]¶

Edit an existing inventory item.

Parameters:

name (str) – name of the item to edit

GET:

Render the edit form with existing item data

POST:

Update the item in the database

Returns:

Rendered template or redirect to inventory page

Return type:

str | Response

inventory.app.home()[source]¶

Display the home page after login.

Returns:

Rendered home template.

Return type:

Response

inventory.app.init_database()[source]¶

Initialize the database using sql script from ‘inventory_schema.sql’

Function creates user and inventory tables if they have not been created

inventory.app.inventory()[source]¶

Display the inventory of the current user

Returns:

Render HTML template with current user’s items

Return type:

str

inventory.app.inventory_to_xlsx()[source]¶

Export the current inventory to an XLSX file

Returns:

XLSX file download

Return type:

Response

inventory.app.inventory_to_xml()[source]¶

Export the current inventory to an XML file.

Returns:

XML file download

Return type:

Response

inventory.app.load_user(user_id)[source]¶

Flask-login user loader

Parameters:

user_id (str) – Takes the ID of a user as a string

Returns:

An instance of User class if it exists in the database, otherwise None

Return type:

User | None

Handle user login

GET:

Renders the login page

POST:

Checks inputted user info and logs them in if it exists

Returns:

Render template or redict to home page

Return type:

str | Response

Returns:

Redirect to login page

Return type:

Response

inventory.app.low_stock()[source]¶

Displays all items with quantity less than 11

Returns:

Render low stock template

Return type:

str

Handle user registration

GET:

Render the registration form

POST:

Insert a new user into the database with hashed password

Returns:

Rendered template or redirect response

str | Response
